resources.string: Wait till transaction is added to blockchain
Your passcode will be used to unlock your wallet and send money
Passcode did not match. Try again.
Error occurred while saving your passcode. Please, try again.
ADEX is a decentralized, real-time\nand non-custodial exchange built\non 0x protocol technology
Trade Ether and Ethereum-based\ntokens directly with other users
Trade peer-to-peer any ERC20\ntoken from your own wallet\nwithout trading fees

The reason you need wETH is to be able to trade ETH for other ERC-20 tokens on decentralized platforms like TradEx. Because decentralized platforms running on Ethereum use smart contracts to facilitate trades directly between users, every user needs to have the same standardized format for every token they trade. This ensures tokens don\’t get lost in translation.\n\n When you \'wrap\' ETH, you aren\'t really wrapping so much as trading via a smart contract for an equal token called wETH. If you want to get plain ETH back you need to \'unwrap\' it. AKA trade it back for plain ETH.
You have not enabled biometric on this device. Go to Settings > Security to set up fingerprint or face access.
The encrypted data holding your wallet was recently invalidated because your Android lock screen was changed
Set up a lock screen on this device to continue. Go to “Settings” > “Security” > “Screen Lock” and enable the lock screen setting.
You are using a third-party keyboard. You have to use default keyboard.

The key that will be shown next is the only way to restore your funds if your phone is ever lost, stolen, broken etc.


Make sure that no one is watching your screen.

This app requires that phone has the passcode (screen lock) enabled.

 You may enable it in Android settings.

Please note that when you disabled the PIN on the OS level the security measures in safe storage of your phonе made the previously stored data invalid. You will need to Restore your wallet keys to get back to your wallet.
This app requires your phone\'s PIN in order to keep sensitive data from your wallet in Android\'s secure storage and not in the app itself.
This action will delete the Ethereum key (wallet) from this device.
If you don\'t have a backup of this key you will loose the respective funds.

This app is peer-to-peer. It does not depend on any web server or tech support personnel to function. 

It works everywhere as long as there is internet. No entity can block this app from working or to block someone from using it. 

Your funds are securely stored on the phone itself, not anywhere else. 

It’s your responsibility to backup your Key and keep it private. Never show it to anyone. If it’s lost, forgotten or stolen your funds can be used by the person who has your key. 

Do not jailbreak your phone, do not install apps from unknown (untrusted) sources, do not give your device to untrusted people, and keep the Operating System on your phone up to date. The security of your funds depends on this. 

The entire code powering this app been open to the public scrutiny since the beginning. We tried to build the most secure and decentralized exchange we could, however there are no guarantees that there are no unintended software issues. That said, this exchange is likely to be significantly more secure than any smartphone exchange app out there. 

Some generic non-private app data like currency exchange rates are stored on decentralized storage(IPFS).
Something went wrong.\nAuth data can\'t be decrypted so app data will be reset now and you need to re-enter your mnemonic key to restore wallet.
